comment: I'm mixed and I did not see any sign of racism in this game. There is a guy called Peter the Black, a treacherous duelist, however Peter Black is actually... white! The whole game happens in Bohemia (Czechia), a country that did not take part in African slavery or slave trade. I know that Czechs are not so fan of mixed or white people people, but I never heard of people mistread because of their colours. Claiming that the game is racist does not make any sense. It's like making a game about Ethiopia in V century and complaining that the game is racist because it has no white people.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @user-pe9qg3hg3k
comment: Seeing as I've just picked this game up, as gaming is a timeless thing and all.. Games which are Historically accurate are there to educate as much as (if not more than) entertain, and when you are not educating people correctly, you are essentially erasing that part of history that you are not telling correctly. When you are erasing history, it's worse than forgetting it, because to forget it means there is a shadow of the mistakes that one can learn from in the back of ones mind. When the history is erased to the point people don't know what the truth was, then the opportunity to learn, the precedent and its outcome is also not known, meaning there is more a likeliness that the road will be travelled once more. The lack of a particular ethnic or religious minority (or majority, depending on your perspective) is not a form of racism, it's the motive behind this lack of inclusion. All the SJWs of the world need to realised that it's not the action that should be judged, but why the action is necessary. If I was to write a movie on an all boys boarding school, am I misogynistic that I am not including women? If I am to write a scene in a woman's toilet, am I feminist for not depicting males inside of this area? That I have not mentioned any of the trans genders, am I non inclusive for 'leaving them out'? SJWs are so desperate to fight for a cause, that they deliberately ignore all reason to prop up their agenda of self importance

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @princevimbai1
comment:
I think the SJW misrepresent the genuine racial issues that are there in this time and age. The context of this game is such that it would be incredibly unlikely (not completely impossible) to find a black person, or really anyone who is not European in Bohemia at that time. In fact, it might even have been unlikely to find a French man in the game since I am not too convinced international movement was such a big thing, or even easily possible at that time. As a black man, I don't mind the lack of black people and I think it is unfair to attack the developers for making the game historically accurate. 

We have really problems to talk about, please let's not waste our time and disenfranchise our struggles with such useless, nonsensical arguments. You make everyone fighting for real improvements and real grievances being met look stupid. If I was playing a game about medieval Japan, I wouldn't expect to see a white person or a black person, especially deep in land and we should not get it twisted.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @IsaSaien
comment:
I would actually argue that kingdom come is not racist or sexist BECAUSE it shows that sexism and racism can be bad in a way, the game handles social comentary by showing situations in wich sexism is a problem, now I cant remember if it touches on racism because there were no minorities in the game (wich is pretty accurate) but im damn sure at multiple times the game criticises sexism and religious extremism by showing how it leads to bad situations.

Cant remember examples of the top of my head but those moments in the game in wich women are mistreated for being women are not meant to make you agree with what the characters are doing, but to reflect on how that behavior was once the norm, and understand that such things wouldnt fly now

comment:
About 4:49: that's not a typo, that's just the word prove-ably. As in "possible to prove something". The claim they are making is something along the lines of "having people of colour in medieval Bohemia would have been historically accurate".They then immediately cite a source for the claim.

I think your claim goes something like "there were no people of colour in medieval Bohemia". You don't cite any sources for it. You seem to misread the article at 5:46 as the phrase you point to is an unsourced tweet from the lead designer of Kingdom Come, and the article goes on to cite historical sources that debunk his assertion.

Did you not read the articles at all before just reacting? It looks like you just turned on your camera and started talking without fact-checking (heh, czech-ing) anything. Or did you, like, consciously choose to misrepresent the articles? In any case, step up your game, man.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @wingingitwithbleep8934
comment: Long time viewer here and I really hate the condescending tone you have in this video. Your lack of understanding of race relations in America is obvious to me... furthermore, as an African American, I have played KCD and enjoyed it so far.  I never thought it was racist, I thought it was a story they were trying to tell based on something very specific. BUT philosophically speaking, the lack of representation of large swaths of populations in our multi billion dollar entertainment industry (games) is and has always been the *REAL* censorship here. Lack of diversity from the bottom up has done a hell of a lot more damage to very real people than the perceived hammer that is coming down on ‚Äúneckbeards‚Äù or "white privilege" (Ironic Vavra was wearing a shirt that said those things under the word "BASED" that stems from African American Rap Artist Lil B) Vavra‚Äôs games are still being made but Games reflecting the realities of women and minorities, on a large scale, are not (compared to dominant culture, gender, etc.) This disconnect that frames afflicted females and minorities calling for more equal representation as "SJW" aka ‚Äúcensorship‚Äù is a very real shame. We aren't censoring anyone by speaking up against something that has been happening for years. Also, stop saying the average person doesn't care about representation in fictional works of art. Speak for yourself or maybe other whites. The avg Minority or woman cares.  Why is it so hard for you to believe that millions of gamers are POCs or women that do CARE about representation in their games? I'm all for KCD being as "Historically" accurate as it wants to be, as I said I am playing it and I like the story.. but do not act like I shouldn't care about my representation in general when all I see in 95% of games for my entire 31 years of life are white males.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Exodon2020
comment:
Bohemia was one of the most rural provinces of the Holy Roman Empire. How much multi-Culturalism do you find in rural backwaters even today? In Europe some people still lose their shit over a family moving there from another province of the same f***ing country. The big ports at the shoreline are a different story but those aren't portrayed in the game.

I don't really get behind this forced diversity thing haunting game studios these days. What sense does it make to develop a game about WW2 just to give people the opportunity to side with the German Army as a black woman. Calling it ahistoric would be a huge understatement - this is outright downplaying the entire racist aspect behind Nazi ideology. I'm all in for the emancipation of races and genders in real life. But I beg to keep realistic for games - at least for as long as their goal is to create a realistic atmosphere behind it. A black blacksmith called Heinrich living in 15th century Bohemia located in the heart of Europe is not realistic.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @StevenFox80
comment:
There were melting pots in 1400 in which you would have met people from all over the known world - however that would NOT have been in Bohemia. Prague would have lots of people from European countries and maybe even as far as from Novgorod, Hungary, Northern Italy or France and maybe even a trader from the Ottoman Empire - but the latter would have been a extremely rare occurrence. A black person from sub-Sahara would have been a sensation outside of Iberia, Sicily and other places with Muslim influences. 

Besides that, I really don't get the discussion. You can't play a woman in The Witcher 3 that game is everyone's (justified) favorite... And Geralt gets more pussy than Charlie Sheen, I've never heard anyone complain about that...

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @bigjoe4243
comment:
My piece: Games depicting modern socially unacceptable themes should be left alone by people who don't play them and by radical, I mean RADICAL SJWs. Though with that said, said games should also subtly instill modern values, such as through moral side quests with appropriate dialogue.

e.g:
A band of traders from the East are trapped by bandits in the nearby woods. Investigate and eliminate the threat to our roads.

Upon finding said traders, they will find them being of middle-eastern descent (No mention of their race is necessary, just their origin point. More may be revealed regarding their culture and ethnicity if you are to speak with them). They will then reward you in a manner appropriate (Companions, discounts, access to their goods, reputation, weapons, armor, insider information on your enemies).

Something of that sort. You teach people through subtle side quests that human life is valuable and a good deed is a good deed, no matter who it's for. By depicting it without shoving it down people's throats, and by not making it a required task, you give people the choice to simply do the decent thing of helping other people. People have to want to change and must see that that change will be good or bad for them. That is how we learn.

Sure some people learn by having the knowledge shoved down their throats and beaten into their heads, but since when has someone completely changed by force? Can an alcoholic quit just by being strapped down to a bed and forced to watch anti-drinking commercials? No, he'll play along and get a drink as soon as he's free. It's the same for racism, sexism and any other biases. If you want people to change, you engage in dialogue. Convince them to change. Constant badgering will get you nothing but another hater for your cause, be you SJW or racist. If you want the other side to change, show proof, show evidence, spin a convincing argument that will make them go "Guy, may have a point. Lemme look into this..."

And there is my rant for this. Got anything to add to my piece or counter it? You're welcome to it. I actually look forward to it. Talking to people of varying ideas has always been interesting to say the least and more opinions help me construct my opinions in the future. The best part about being human in my opinion, we can think in so many avenues of thought and arrive at so many different conclusions. Shame that some people nowadays have forgotten how it was to listen, to speak and to integrate the ideas we can gain from them...

comment:
Did any of you people read the article? Or watch the video?
It's not calling the game racist for not having black people. It's warning interested people that the game's lead developer is (supposedly) a racist, so if you don't like that and don't want to support that, maybe you should boycott the game. Simple. Understand that before posting comments mocking non-existent arguments and positions.
Now, i'm not saying he is a racist or sexist or anything really. I don't know him. But people in this comment section are mocking the article incorrectly.
Also, why are you so angry about this? It's just some piece a random person wrote to the Website's Inbox section. You kind of forgot to mention that, didn't ya? Not to mention, you didn't even have the decency of including a link in the description, I had to find it myself...
This reminds me of the fake controversy with the "racism in Cuphead". You know, a bunch of youtubers pretending that there's a scandal going on about Cuphead being racist, if tho there wasn't any. Not trying to question your honesty or anything, you might just be one caught in the crossfire, trying to defend a game you like and a developer you like

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Traeumeer
comment:
This video is so stupid on so many levels. First of all: Why bother with asking the question when you make it clear from the beginning that you already made your decision and don't even bother with checking the arguments for either side? Instead you go to google image-search and take the top results as the answer to that question? Well done, mate.
I have the feeling that the problem with the game and the developer is not so much a problem with historical accuracy (which can be debated) but much more with the views of the head of the game itself. Quick research made clear, that Vavra is not just the bearded geek that designs games but has very strong opinions about these issues in question and takes his nationality and "czech heritage" for a good argument to hush people with other opinions. So, when someone asks a question about the lack of POCs in this game he answers that he can't be lectured about his own country and history by a american - I do not understand what the nationality has to do with somebodys understanding of history, but fine. But to identify Bohemia with the Czech Republic is another example of him looking through a lens on history and not the SJWs that keep asking questions about the "Historical Accuracy".
But what I was to mention is the first place was the evidence that even people of middle and eastern europe knew about the existence of POCs. There are many depictions of POCs in works made in german cities and medievalPOC even found a illustration made in Bohemia in the 1420s depicting a black woman. As with every source there is room for speculation, of course, but the fact that POCs were depicted in the 15th century art all across europe is a strong argument for the view that there could be interactions between white europeans and POCs. By the way: The man routes during the Crusades went right through or beneath Bohema or the Czech Republic, so wayfarer and crusader using this routes could have travelled with POCs on their way back home. Even the Ottoman Empire went as far the Balkans, and the muslims were not white.

So, Daniel Vavra and friends, medieval Europa was not all white, even though POCs may have been a strong minority, there has been the evidence that the european folk was familiar with them. Why do you keep saying they didn't exist? Is this not much more of a political agenda than the game-ruining-political-correctness of the SJWs?

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @gregortheoverlander4122
comment:
So I just want to kinda comment on the conception of race back then. Their point wasn't that racism was accepted back then.

Before the commodification of Africans into slavery for work in the new world there was essentially no distinction made for race. Black, white, arab, asian, etc... didn't exist. People were just people. It wasn't until the riches of the new world required a slave class that the conception of race and race hierarchy was created. And to be clear it was created, artificially, to allow for moral and upstanding Christians to own and enslave an entire group of people.

In 1400's Europe there were some African slaves, some white slaves, and some middle eastern slaves, but that slavery was in no way based on Race. 

So, just to be clear. The point of the article they cite is that Race was not conceived of yet in the middle ages. 

That in no way strengthens their argument. I highly doubt that any average European would ever see a black man or woman. 

The vast, vast majority of all countries were homogeneous during this time period. The Ottoman Empire and The Spanish Empire would have been the only countries to consistently come into contact with any race other than the one that made up the majority of their respective country.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @janpolak7013
comment:
Well they are tad too categorical about, Bohemia and especially Prague at this age was somewhat center of the empire and one of the trade nods (Charles himself diverted trade routes so they went through Prague, making her more cospolitan in some sense), so there could have been some passing merchant and travelers from all over Europe. 
One prime example of such people is https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibrahim_ibn_Yaqub , who predates the era by far, but in my view makes the whole topic not so black and white.
However, Wenceslaus rule was one of turmoil and thus less properous (which is the set of the game story) and in effect, less colorful.
But the notion that there medieval Europe was "melting pot of races" implying mixed demographics might be correct on the frontiers like Hispania or Sicily or present day Russia or Anatolia, but undocumented in the central Europe under Wenceslaus IV.

author: @ultramarinus2478
comment:
Trust Resonant and thrust me. There was as much "black" people of african descent in middle Europe, as "white" people of european descent in middle Africa around year 1400 after Christ. 

Travels were extremely dangerous even in tens or hundrets of kilometers, not mentioning thousands of kilometers. Bussines at that time with Africa or African kingdoms was virtualy nonexistent, therefore every hictoricaly accurate portrayal of the game would not include non-europeans, because of the same reason why not to include i-phones, not because of some nonexistent "skin colour preferency".

Also regarding slavery... Fun fact for everyone who would try this game. There was a class of kings subjects known as "serfs", whos rights (including right to have a possession) was EXTREMELY CLOSE to that of a slave. All of Bohemian serfs was people of European descent and they were serving to the people of European descent. Including (at some point in history) "the first night right" of the local noble over all serf woman on "his" lands. Not clean, not good, not softharted, but a bucket of midleages moral shit amont white people. 

Would the "protestors" like to see their main character to rise from this? Because the white one surely WILL, and because of historical accuracy, there is basicaly not much from where to go (there were serfs, there vere nobles and there were clerics, and the heavy lifting did the serfs, therefore they was the most numerous "caste" at that time).

author: @vycanismelodis
comment:
I agree with you, but a lot of the things you said and did in this video were quite intellectually dishonest. 

When searching through his tweets of course near to the release of the game that's what he's going to be talking about, rather than political stuff. It felt like you were cherry picking. 

Also, when you were looking at the demographics of Bohemia in the 15th century, Google Images isn't going to be a great source. Funnily enough, there weren't any photos back then and paintings were mostly of rich people, nobles, kings etc. Even if there were black people in Bohemia at the time (and I don't know whether it's true) they would not have been of that rank to have pictures of them. Archaeological evidence would be what you should have been looking at. The article said 'provable' rather than 'probable' meaning it can be proven. Check academic sources before making such a video, man.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Chiathur
comment:
Thanks for this. Most ppl don't check the validation of content from interviews, they take for the truth. Why? Because it was an official interview, why s/o should be lying there? Well duh... Nowadays ppl try to make a trigger out of everything. Looks like some other humans are just up to lit a fire where there's no tinder/reason. I'm livin' with this over sensibility about this topic my whole life now and I'm oversaturated about this pointless accusations. In our world there can be Caucasian, Afro American, African, Asian and Australian racist, this is not any longer a "whites only" club.

Dear video creator, let's not forget, that for instance Britain and Spain enslaved, tortured and killed colored ppl also, the difference was, that noone was there to record and judge their crimes, so don't do it yourself and pull the "Nazi" trigger, it's just exhausting.

This specific accusation, disarmed in the video above is the best example, that this waves are driven by trolls that love to lead wrappers, no matter what topic, but hate's always a easy one to trigger. Witcher didn't have any black characters, Kingdom Come didn't have any.. Guys, this is no political statement or conspiracy! If you'd make a game in Africa's environment and you'd see only white ppl, you can ask the devs what they're up to? Anything else is poor feedback... like calling s/o a racist, because not all languages are fully voiced. At some point you can stop developing, because you cannot pay for this madness. Games are for fun, to revive fantasy worlds or long gone times. They HAVE worked with historicans, if s/b is claiming they're all racists, maybe he's the only racist, no matter what skin color. ;) Internet anonymity ftw! Anyone could claim he has skin color XY and start a hate raid ~

If black ppl have been more advanced than white in history and conquered their coasts white ppl would have ended up being slaved. Fearing the unknown is a human attribute and sadly even today some didn't evolve past it, because we still have scare mongers. So don't jump the hate-hype-train, better get into business, develope your own game and hope that society don't try to forbid you to create your story, because there are political correctness traps everywhere like being displayed in the video. 

And for all the personal flavors our world's individuals have and may keep: Mods. Try to get into modding and mod your world away, if you can't play it vanilla. Even if it destroys immersivity, because you would never have been accepted in medieval times by their people as black skin was a curiosity. Hell, as a white peasant you've been avoided by most of the ppl if you'd had a skin anomalousness. Because this could only be a mark of the devil. Ppl were made to think straight in any way by the church then and because (all!) humans' minds DO have a "us" and "them" preference in their mind. This is what we have to get over in our lifes. But still that's a game and if there is a mod to change the main characters skin color, these people wouldn't mind, because they're not real... It's just for your personal identification with the character.

In DA: Inquisition there was a shitstorm, because of "whitewashing" with mods. Muistn't be, but it's also wrong to restrict it, because then you can continue with a lot of things to shut down. In your own flat/house you DON'T have to be political correct, if it's not your nature. Your thoughts are free as long as noone gets harmed. And I really mean "harmed", not that kind of "harmed" where ppl feel threatened in their very existence because they see a game's visual mod that don't matches their tastes of makes them kinda easy-upset. If I don't like short haired women, I don't have to start a crusader to bannish all the short haired mods out there. 

Leave the policy out of modding guys, this is a sandbox discussion noone can win anything but more rage and confrontations with no point nor end.

Kingdom Come is their first game, it's not perfect, but a better start than a bunch of other titles. There might be a aligned lip synch for other languages. They might align scripts to start more accurate, but yet it is a beautiful game. There may be only a male character and I know for some there's no excuse, even if there is. And its indeed no excuse, but a fact. Because it's hard to rise towards nobility as a male peasant; to play as a female character THAT TIMES you only could have married a noble the other 'ways'.. well, I won't get onto this trigger, just check the "women in midieval times" articles. This could work in a fantasy world like Skyrim or Witcher, or playing a woman that cloaks herself as male, but what's the point there?
Some might see "only white people" I see a classical midieval landscape and its poor peasants, and they are well designed and not blessed with overnatural beauty, because they just weren't in this times.

This is it finally, most didn't read the half as always, but if you did get until here, thanks for your open mind. Let's just calm down guys... world's like a powder-keg already, there's no need to feed the digital trollings...

The journalists who attack this game with their pseudo-history are a part of the field of "critical theory".

Critical theory is a part of the Frankfurt School, basically it's cultural marxism and marxist sociology. They teach it in some universities when you study sociology, history, religion, philosophy and journalism. Typically, according to the field, they'll call it something like "hit-crit", "lit-crit" (historical critical theory, litterature critical theory) and so forth. 

Critical theory is about "critique of society and culture by applying knowledge from the social sciences". They want to change our society of today by changing modern populations perceptions on previous history.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Derploop
comment:
Regardless as to whether it's racist or not, Bohemia was at one stage a part of the Roman Empire so it's almost impossible that it was all white just due to the deliberate policy of the Roman Empire to recruit legions from one place (North Africa, for example) and send them to far away places so they had no reason to form a rebellion.

Point being, it's not necessarily racist but it is evidence of either poor research from the game designers or a deliberate white washing of history. If one were to view it as the second, it can't be seen as anything but racist. 

Now, I don't know enough about the situation to comment but it's definitely a big oversight to not have any characters at least hinting a non white ancestry, if that is the case.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Timbo5000
comment: In the medieval ages, Europe was hardly a melting pot of races, but there were other races. Lots of Jews came here in the 1500's or before IIRC, and they would have been Middle Eastern looking back then. They were here for so long that they're now essentially white Europeans. But fully black people? Few and far in between. There are examples of even highly placed black people in Europe back then, but of course those were extremely rare. Also, slavery never brought lack people to Europe. There was no slavery in Europe. Every man that set foot on European soil was automatically a free man, this has been the case since like the 1100's. Our empires exploited the fact that this rule didn't apply to foreign land and held slaves in colonies, but never in Europe. All black people in Europe were free men. What brought at least a few black people to Europe was the fact that they were part of our empire and travelled here, not that they were forced to come. Otherwise our black population would be huge, which it really isn't. Even in our current "melting pot" situation we're mostly 90-95% white. By comparison, the US is like 65% white because of how it used to rely on slave labour (and had a lot of black people present) and of course its status as an immigration country.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @David13ushey
comment:
So here's the thing.  What we think of as 'race' didn't exist back in Europe until about the late 18th century, early 19th century as colonialism was reaching its peak.  Through out Europe there were people with fair skin that became progressively darker the further south you went.  Your skin color was absolutely irrelevant compared to your religion, your lord, and your economic background.  Most people did not travel.  It was illegal to do so.  The only places you would find a 'melting pot' would be the few big trade cities like Rome, Venice, and Genoa.  Otherwise, people stayed where they were at.  Bohemia is north of the alps, and so most people were, understandably, fair skinned.

Now would it be impossible to find a dark skinned person?  No, but it would be rare.  Not because of racism, but because of religion.  Most Muslims were hostile to Christianity, and understandably so given the crusades and the Reconquista.  Heresy was often a death sentence, so if you were dark skinned, you were at high risk of being assumed to be a Muslim and killed.  Skin color was simply an indication that you likely came from a Muslim country.

Race was the result of colonialism and immigration.  For the first time ever, an indian could travel fairly reliably halfway around the world.  Suddenly the alien was coming to the home country, and people needed mental justifications for slavery and colonization.  The justifications were pretty severe: these people were primitive and it was western culture's right to uplift them.  Or, these people were all heathens and we had to colonize and genocide them to save their souls.  Or, these people are too stupid and lazy to survive, so we have to enslave them or they'll die.  It justified economic exploitation.  And to be fair, it wasn't just dark skinned people.  Irish, Italians, Poles, Greeks, and Russians were also stigmatized as being 'non-white'.

People criticizing KC:D for 'racism' literally are judging 14th century history by 600 years of change.  To pretend like 1400 Bohemia was anything like 1850's America is ridiculous.  The world changed, some for the worst, mostly for the better.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @eruditootidure2611
comment:
Okay, I think it's pretty dumb to call the game racist because of one developer, but some of the points in this video are just... bad.  For one, the dev's definitely retweeted/posted some shady stuff; I wouldn't say it's actually racist, but I can see how it would be seen as such, and going through his twitter without finding any specific instances only shows that he hasn't shared anything questionable recently, not that he hasn't done so at all.  As for there being "no black people in 1400s bohemia"... That's not necessarily wrong, but it's highly unlikely, and sounds like the speech of an at least moderately racist individual who lacks the understanding of historical nuance I would expect from this game.  There most certainly were black people in Bohemia at the time, since there were definitely black people in the approximate region in the centuries before and immediately after, and looking through a selection of like three paintings doesn't really disprove that - if you'd spent some more time looking into Bohemian artwork, you' may have seen some of the many depictions of black people painted around the same time (look at the works of Theodoric of Prague, and you'll find several examples).

There have been black people moving to Europe for a very long time; they would've made up a much smaller minority than they do today, but saying "there were no black people in 1400s Bohemia, period" is beyond historically illiterate.  I mean, I wouldn't have taken much issue with the game having no black people myself, since they were such a small minority that it wouldn't have been too surprising for the protagonist of the game to simply have not encountered any, but saying that there literally weren't any black people is kind of stupid - I'd expect better from the developer of such a historical-accuracy focused game, but no.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Gentleman...Driver
comment:
You should have done your research a bit more accurate. Those rumors occured because Daniel Vavra was wearing t-shirts of scandinavian rock bands who are known for their racist textes or are at least very controverse because of their members. Also he stated out that he wishes to be born in the medeival time period because a man could be a man back then, and that he could take everything he wants alone with his strength. Also he commented in diffrent occasions that he doesnt like the gender discussion and the increasing diversity in his country. I have to clearify: That alone does not mean that he is racist whatsoever. But this is the origin of the rumors.
As for the game: I agree with you. Not implementing black people in an medeival historic setting of Bohemia is not racist. I dont say there were no blacks in this time period in this lands, but clearly: There were very few of them. And if you were diffrent back then, people would have react more cautious on you. You have to imagine that the world was "smaller" for those people. Most of them only did know about the villages around their home, and messages took several days to get to them. Even (white) strangers would be observed suspiciously. I mean everyone could rob and slaughter you. These times were brutal.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Mr_Maiq_The_Liar
comment:
Let‚Äôs try to follow the logistics of one black person trying to get to bohemia. 
Step 1: know that Europe exists. Not likely, why would Europe ever come in contact with Africa? A continent of Pagans, most likely they didn‚Äôt know Africa existed, you certainly can‚Äôt see Europe from across the Mediterranean, but hell, trade might be nice, so if there‚Äôs trade mission accomplished. 
Step 2: want to go there. Unlikely, Europe was just as shit a place as everywhere else, but possible. 
Step 3: get there. 
The masses have the hardest time here, and unfortunately for any argument of the population of black people, they are the masses. They would have to sneak onto a boat, since one you made isn‚Äôt really going to get you there. A noble might be able to go north but why would they want to?
Step 4: survive. 
The second hardest step. Since A, black people are super conspicuous, seeing a black person in Europe is like seeing a purple person today, also, you most certainly won‚Äôt be able to speak the language, and you are pagan, your rituals are different and heretical, and likely to get you killed, there‚Äôs no way for you to function in society. 
Step 5: make it to bohemia. 
Good luck walking from whatever port you landed in, you will need a horse. Good luck getting a horse they are expensive. Considering you would probably have to live as a bandit, no trouble. 
Step 6: settle in bohemia. Why head there and stop? Is there a motive? 
Step 7: if not the time of the game yet, have enough people do the last six steps that you can create a black line.
You can skip a lot of these steps by being forced into a place and made a Slave, or if education and transport to Europe is added to your African community, and all Africans anywhere outside of Africa can trace their lineage to one of these two things. 
A black person somehow ending up in bohemia alive in that time frame. Not fucking likely! And that‚Äôs just if you wanted one black person in the game, some Easter egg bandit with a cool backstory. You want a population you sacrifice realism, defeats the whole purpose of the game

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @J0J0155
comment:
This game isn't NEARLY Racist or sexist, its historically accurate.. Warhorse wasn't trying to be racist or sexist, it was how people were back then! To have a game based in real life and set in that time you would expect to see sexist themes BECAUSE women were homemakers, stay at home wives, and bed partners, while the men handled the "Manly" things... This is before social evolution... To gloss over actual history to include inaccurate races and playable women makes the game not based in reality... and to gloss over history makes it seem like its never happened ... meaning future generations don't learn from our mistakes...

Look at the US... US history was glossed over... Native Americans were nearly wiped out by an illness the immigrates brought with them, and some tribes killed for their land... African american ancestors were enslaved and built this country along with the orders of the immigrates from the "Old World" .... Not many people really know every detail because its so briefly mentioned in historical textbooks... and paints every important historical figure as a Noble person and great... when these people were often seen as any other person in this time and had their own demons... If you have a Native American Tribesman tell you the history of this land you get a WHOLE different story they don't tell you in school...

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @FunkyFyreMunky
comment: Yeah, medieval Europe was such a social melting pot that even white, European Jews were pariahs. People who looked indistinguishable from white European Christians were shunned at all times, forcibly converted whenever possible and accused of ritual murder. Can you imagine the treatment these (entirely fictitious, I assure you) groups of black people in medieval Bohemia would have received? This guy's article reads like a hate-speech open-letter. He sounds like he was frothing at the mouth, apoplectic with self-righteous rage the entire time he was typing, masturbating his ego with indignant spleen-venting. You want to help the cause? Fine, become a human-rights lawyer, become an educator, devote yourself to fund-raising. Don't knock an historically accurate videogame because it doesn't include something that didn't exist.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @jeffreyvalen5242
comment: Hold the phone, Liberal here, and I don't believe that the article or who wrote had any idea what they were talking, however, this is written almost a week after the games release and can admit that there are several moments in the game that are questionable in how it views the Hungarian/Eastern Mercenaries are looked down upon by the lead characters surrounding Henry, i.e Hanush, Radzig, Hans, etc, and from what I see, is that the developers of the game took the route of the eurocentric perspective and historical view at the time of demonizing foreignors not of light skin tones, which let's be honest was very very real at the time. And it is a bad thing by today's standards, but at the same it is a historical accuracy from the point of view of citizens within the Bohemia given that the Catholic Church demonized lands that had other religions to manipulate the populace into hating them and using their faith as a guiding rod to do their bidding and rid foreign problems. Let's not forget that the majority of Islamic influence in Europe at this point had been wiped out due to the threat that it posed to Christendom, i'm not here to say that this article had any validity to it, but the argument of the article is if it was Racist. And to a degree, I believe it was. The history is certainly there, and we all know just how tolerable Europeans, regardless of which kingdom they were, despised anyone associated with dark skin tones which at the time were coincidental with Islamic. Take this how you will, but obviously and historically, this argument does have validity when looking deep into it.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @WillBrown-mc3ub
comment:
Doing a quick search ... there are a few depictions of Africans from Bohemia at this time, but these are artistic drawings ... such as assuming one of the Magi at Jesus's birth was african.Or the depiction of Queen Sheba ... even now most depictions of her are guess-work because she is famous but we don't have a great idea what she looked like ... if you look at the depiction ... she is clearly African but the imagery is Western (the symbolic items, the clothing, etc) 

Others are from long ago ... such as Saint Maurice ... from the 3rd (not 15th) century. Was a real man, real saint ... long dead and gone to heaven ... He was in Europe as a legionnaire and was killed in Switzerland.

It might be interesting after reading up to contain a piece of church artwork (if there existed in this 9km area) Of an African person. Bohemians were actually interested in Africans at this time, not out of meeting and talking to them but their religion ... Orthodox. Bohemians known as Hussites were branded as 'heretics' and defending against Crusades from the Roman Catholic church. Anything or anyone 'not Catholic, but Christian' would have appealed to them. Which country is the oldest Christian nation? Ethiopia ... which is Orthodox. St. Maurice was also Orthodox. Solomon and Sheba were also from this area. 

At one point this fellow (on another site) shows these depictions and says that because of the Battle of Legnica there should be Mongols, Cumans, and other people from the East ... Except the Battle of Legnica was in POLAND .. .which during this time would have had these people present, actually this battle caused more German migrants into Bohemia more than anything. Just as a heads up there were Africans in Medieval Europe but they would be around the Mediterranean ... pilgrims, traders, diplomats ... These areas were primarily Spain, France, and Italy.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @sophiejones7727
comment:
Ok 
1) game isn't out, already saying it's racist. wow. 
2)  if you think the game isn't good enough, make a better one.
However, if you say that having no option for dark skinned character is realistic: that is wrong. People traveled in the Middle Ages, and just like today there were diverse urban areas. Men went to war, fell in love with local girls and stayed. Women married outside of their homelands, sometimes halfway across the world. There were refugees, pilgrims and economic opportunists. The Catholic Church assigns priests to their positions: so a priest could have his origins among any group of people who were part of the Roman church. That all being said: I do believe that Kingdom Come Deliverance takes place in the early 1400s yes? That late date is important, because that was when Europe was at it's most isolated. From 1390-1450, Western Europe was largely cut off from the Middle East and Africa after the failure of the early Crusades and the Great Schism. Any dark skinned people already living there would not have been kicked out, but there wouldn't have been anyone new moving in.  So, while the decision to not include ANY dark skinned option is still not 100% realistic, it isn't revisionist history either. In a game that prides itself on accuracy it's an anomaly, but it's hardly something to get worked up about. It's a bit of a stretch to say that the developer is racist, rather than simply bad at research.  It's not Assassin's Creed: Orgins, but not every game needs to be.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @JohanDanielsson8802
comment:
I am pretty sure most black people in Europe either came themselves as immigrants from Africa, or are descendants of people who came as immigrants from Africa in modern time. A few might have came before that, I once heard about that archeologists had found the remains of a black woman who lived in England during the Roman period.  Black people must have been a very small minority in most of medieval Europe though. And they would not have black descendants today, since there would be practically no other black people around to get children with.

Some rich people in Europe during the seventeenth, eighteenth and nineteenth century also had black servants, which was something of a status symbol since it was so exotic. This is the most famous Swedish example: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustav_Badin I once heard a story about a black man, who was a slave to a Danish noble woman. He escaped and became a sailor, but was found and brought back to his owner. His shipmates collected their money to buy him free, but the noble woman refused to sell him.

There was a very small number of black men in the German army during world war 2. The Nazis was not nearly as afraid of black people as they were of Jews, since black people was such a small minority in Germany back then and easy to recognize on their appearance. Black people were second class citizens, but they could serve in the army. Nazi Germany did not accept women in combat though, until in the end of the war, when the Allies was in Germany and the Nazi government was really desperate. So it is fully possible that a black woman could be allowed to serve in some kind of militia unit, but only in the end of the war.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Jerickjv
comment: The word provable is not a typo. The article author was saying prove -able meaning that he is under the bizarre and mistaken impression that his statements about black people in 1400 Europe are factual and demonstrable. I live in Europe and there's barely a handful of black people living here now in the age of mass transport when crossing the world takes less than a day. In the medieval period most people never traveled more than 20 miles from where they were born. Traveling great distances was hard and wealthy traders on far reaching trade missions were the only ones who would regularly travel any great distances. Why the hell would a bunch of people from Africa and the middle east migrate throughout Europe and settle down all across it? That only makes sense now a days when travel is easy.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @demonkogure99
comment: I tried googling  this but I couldn't find any proper information so I even checked my college search database but didn't  find anything either to substantiate these claims of racism that the author proposed about the game. I do know that there were Romani  gypsies in Europe that were tan and kind of looking like a Italian :] and they were nomads and sometimes had different religious beliefs, I apologize if I spelled their name wrong.   I'm sure there was groups of Afro people because of the Roman Empire  which ended in the 5th century  like somewhere in 1450, I don't know the exact dates since  I'm not a scholar on this  subject  but I'm sure  in Europe there was some after that  and maybe they did go to Bohemia and Bovaria but probably not a lot compared to other parts of Europe, this is all speculation on my part  and even medieval historical scholars do debate each other on historical accuracy  of this period in time so we might find accounts that contradict each other . The only way we can really prove or disprove is through archaeological findings because I'm not sure if  people in Europe had census workers back then that kept track of the ethnicity of their population like they do now .

author: @artinaam
comment: Expecting to see someone else than white people in Central Europe at the beginning of 15th century is plain ignorance. You could meet someone of Asian descent in Eastern Europe (namely Tatars) or Turks in the Balkans/Greece and Moors in modern-day Spain and Portugal, but that's all. The only chance for a medieval Bohemian to see a black person would be while taking a look at some representation of St. Maurice in a church (as he was usually portrayed as a dark-skinned knight/soldier).

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @TynamM
comment:
The problem with this video is that it's nonsense.  There were black people all over medieval Europe, dating all the way back to the Roman empire, and it had exactly jackshit to do with the slave trade.

"Historical accuracy" is only an excuse if you don't know any fucking history.  The idea that people in Middle Ages Europe were all white is simply, flat-out, untrue.  Any serious historian knows better.  Medieval Europe had trade routes stretching from England to Byzantium, to Egypt, to Israel, and to China.  And people moved with the trade.

The popular image you have - that they were 100% white - is mostly an invention of Victorian historians (who didn't cope well with non-white scholars) and Hollywood (which wasn't exactly the centre for realistic casting).  15th century illustrations - the time period of the game - have plenty of black people in.  And so do the historical documents.

The game is all-white because the lead dev's a racist.

I backed it early.  I love my copy of Kingdom Come.  It's a great game.  But I backed it before I knew about the asshat in charge, and I've doubled my donation to anti-racist organisations to make up for it.

If you want to enjoy the game, despite the racist asshat in charge?  Go for it.

But don't make excuses for the racist bullshit by talking about "historical accuracy", because real European history has brown skins in it.

You're flat-out wrong on this one.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Yoni123
comment:
http://robertwguthrie.com/whats
Racial attitudes based on modern perceptions are often treated as fact, and this reflects neither the reality of European history nor the current state of historical scholarship. The racial categories that we cling so desperately to in the modern day did not exist, and to exclude people of color and women based on poorly researched preconceptions is something that we have to stop doing.

Including minorities and women in historical fiction is not shoehorning, or pandering, any more than the standard male power fantasy is pandering to men. Indeed, it is entirely acceptable and believable fiction, if researched and written correctly. We routinely accept events that are wildly improbable and without historical precedent ‚Äî like commoners becoming knights ‚Äî without batting an eyelash, and this reflects, more than anything, the fact that we are still struggling with racial prejudice and that we, as a society, have a pretty poor grasp of history.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @giorgiannicartamancini3917
comment:
I think one big problem is in the use of the world "Europe", in this game our character doesn't travel through Europe, he travels in Bohemia which nowadays it's roughly half of the Czech republic(he doesn't even travel through all Bohemia), in the center of the continent where virtually no African or middle Eastern person would have wanted to live or trade.
Unfortunately especially Americans have the tendency of seeing Europe as a homogeneous culture, which is a REALLY wrong perception, of course there is a basic shared culture but the regional differences can be substantial.
So, in conclusion, you would have seen people of colour in some parts of Europe (mostly middle Eastern or North African so very few, if any, black people), just not in this one
P.S. I just want to specify that I don't mean to say that no black person has ever been in the area of the game in 1402(how could everyone know that lol), just that such an event is so unlikely that's more accurate to not portray it

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @alexlaza5301
comment:
Deliverance is a game that aimed to be a hardcore game that as historically accurate as possible, so no out of place things like Black or Asian character or no playable female is a very good thing. 
But I can't agree with you at all for the CODWWII case. I guess you never really played CODWWII, and only got the conclusion from internet. As the campaign of CODWWII have no out of place things like black or female Nazi soldiers alike, in fact you don't even have combined race units on US side, and the only female combatants are French underground resistance which is historically accurate. 
As for the Multiplayer experience. CODs MP was never about anything even close to historically accurate, nor any realistic immersive experience, but rather a very casual experience that don't have anything to do with the historical background. And since the player character is fully customizable, I don't see there is any problem to give player the option to customize it they want for what ever reasons.
Honestly, this days both sides had many people being overly sensitive. As many liberals are pursuing "PC" in unreasonable ways (as the KGC case), but meanwhile also many conservatives were overly abusing the word and concept of "PC" as the reason to criticize basically anythings they don't like (as the COD case).

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @bismuthcrystal9658
comment:
Wow, what a libelous moron. And I will never understand the claim that supporting GamerGate makes one a bigot. That's like claiming all people who eat at McDonald's are racist because some people are. It's a headless, unorganized bunch of people using a hashtag for crying out loud. There is some willful doublethink going on to enable that illogic in order to justify dismissing a whole class of people (sound familiar?). Though dismissing something as "SJW" is just as reductive. Dismiss people because they're idiots.

I will say that I'd have liked being able to play as a woman. Joan of Arc is justification enough. And you're the protagonist. Why couldn't you be exceptional. It just would have to be hard mode. Which would be cool. But not including it is by no means sexist - especially as it would be so hard to do. It couldn't just be a simple name swap and a new model. You'd have to have sexist jerks calling out to drop the sword and get back to the kitchen and whatnot. That'd take a lot of resources. And halfassedly adding a female protagonist without taking the effort to show how disenfranchised women were at the time would arguably be worse.

Oh, and by the way, "people of colo(u)r" is an acceptable thing. "Colo(u)red people" isn't. "Black" would be... for black people, specifically. "People of colo(u)r" refers to anyone not-white, generally. So yeah, I'm sure there were some Middle Eastern people wandering about medieval Bohemia, VERY occasionally. Probably less commonly than lepers. So if this game features no lepers, clearly it's leperist. Ugh.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Bidmartinlo
comment:
Medieval European peoples were not racist, of course it was possible but they wouldn't make a black person, *Saint Maurice,* a saint if they were *all* racist. And coincidentally, the picture painted of him was painted by a *German* around the start of the Renaissance. And there is plenty of Renaissance art out there depicting black peoples as equals, sometimes of a higher status than the average European. Not only that, once the slave trade in Africa got serious enough; the Catholic church made a ban on it at least.

We can never be certain of how all people felt about blacks during the Middle ages themselves _(which was a pretty long time for Europe),_ but we can be certain that in the Renaissance... artists could paint black people as betters without being killed for it. Religion, however, that there you can preach about hatred. Christians fighting Christians over petty disputes, the Muslims doing the same and the Crusades and Jihads against Christians and Muslims. You know the drill... Still, we are all human by the end of the day. Race, _even though everyone else are annoying with their stupid laws and cultures,_ doesn't really matter in the end. And know that if people could do better 500 years ago; we can do better now!

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @davidsears5176
comment:
Historical accuracy is not racism.

Europe in 1403 was misogynist, racist, ignorant and religious to a point I would call 'insanity'.  Is this 'right'?  Is this 'good'?  No.  But what it is is accurate.

Not only were there few minorities in Bohemia at this time, but, to be perfectly blunt, they weren't likely to be treated well.  The game's intro/tutorial has a thing involving some xenophobia of the sole GERMAN in this Bohemian village.  No, this is not how things should be... we've evolved as a culture past this (well, most of us have... as yesterday's tragic events prove, nazism is alive and well).  They were called the Dark Ages, not the Rainbow Coalition of Peace, Tolerance and Understanding Era.

To create a game that allowed you to play a variety of races... or gender, sexual orientation etc.... would violate the historical accuracy that is the bedrock concept of the game.  They could candy coat it, make it 'PC' and as 'inclusive' as possible.  Or they could be accurate to the time and setting.  They could not do both.  Since the core premise of the game was historical accuracy, what should they have done instead?

There is no racism here.  There is no malice.  This is an attempt to recreate medieval Bohemia.

I actually consider the historical revisionism proposed for this game to be FAR more dangerous by distorting the past and reality.  It's the same reason I am so uncomfortable with holocaust deniers... we need to remember the dark chapters of human history and view them withOUT rose colored glasses.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @TheExkrementor
comment:
I think the whole controversy is kind of ridiculous, if you put it that way. 
Who cares about the fakt that in a game, depicting 14. Century, rural bohemia, no black people are to be found? 
Its a game, a piece of art, and it should be treated like it.

However, with this comes another dimension, which should not be ignored. 
Daniel V√°vra has his political agenda and his worldview and so has anyone of us. Thinking that this does not influence his artistic work is in my oppinion rather naive. 
This wouldn¬¥t realy be a big deal in other games like The Witcher, or Mount and Blade, but in a game like  Kingdom Come, which markets its historical accuracy , this is something to concider, and not just brush of, with the words: "keep politics out of my games".
 Expecially in a game like this it is important to talk about this issue. V√°vra is not an historian and the picture presented in KC can never be that authentic, like every depiction of the middle ages is just an aproximation of reality. Especially when your heart and soul are that much connected with a historical period, it might be realy hard to overcome certain ideologicaly influenced narrativs of history. Now think about this: KC¬¥s version of the middle ages will reach more people than all scientific papers on the middle ages of the last decade combined. 
This is in my opinion the problem: 
V√°vra has his ideology, and therefore it is necessary to be able to talk about how this might influence his work. I dont want to call him a racist or other terms, because I dont know that much about this guy. However, having a public presentation in a Burzum T-Shirt, might not realy have been the smartest move of him, and his categorical denial of the possibility europe in the middleages might not have been just all white, certainly didnt help either. How much this ideology actually manifests it self in the game, is another thing, but just the possibility of this happening is hard to deny.
In short:
V√°vra had his moments, that put him in a bad light and i am not here to judge about him. Still you have to accept the need to talk about this issue, because this game and it¬¥s version of the middle ages, with all the ideology included, will influence more people than years worth of accademic research on the middle ages.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @rogthepirate4593
comment:
Were there black people in medieval Europe? Sure, here and there. Especially in larger population centers, port towns and the like, around the mediterranean sea especially. Were there some in the more backwater rural areas of Bohemia? Doubtful, very doubtful. Are there other ethnicities even in that rural backwater? Oh, absolutely. Cumans, for example (which are asian). Oh, wait, those are in the game and accurately represented.
Probably some turks, too. Haven't seen any yet but chances are they might just be accurately represented as well. 
That aside there are also lots of other ethnicities in the game (which are all "white", but that is NOT a homogenous group no matter how much SJWs claim the contrary), like Germans, Hungarians etc. 
Racist? The mere thought is laughable.

I believe that, not only black people, but the LGBTQQIAAP community are not properly represented in 1403 Bohemia.

Also, I have yet to see a black horse in any of the promo videos for this ‚Äúgame‚Äù - totally racist against black horses too! And while I‚Äôm on the subject, I totally object to the word ‚Äúblacksmith‚Äù. This is transparently racist and the word should be changed to something less offensive! 
There is also reference to the ‚ÄúCuman‚Äù mercenaries in this ‚Äúgame‚Äù, which is way too bias in favour of the ‚Äúmale‚Äù. This should be Cu-person or something! 
Rest assured, I will not be playing this horrid ‚Äúgame" as I don‚Äôt want to be subjected to the level of racism you refer to in your article. 
I will save my money and spend it on a game with only black and LGBTQQIAAP people in it. Hopefully this new game will allow me to kill ONLY white privileged men for being bigoted racists. 
I think it should be called ‚ÄòSafe Space‚Äô? 

Yours sincerely 
A snowflake

author: @My-Name-Isnt-Important
comment: Bohemia at the time wasn't a diverse area. It wasn't similar to Barcelona, Rome, Venice or Naples which were huge ports of trade. Coastal regions would have diverse peoples due to merchants coming and going, but as far inland as Bohemia, you would not encounter diversity anywhere near what you have today. The Cumans were mainly a fair skinned people. The only "diversity" would be the nationality, culture, and the region you were from. Czechs, Germans, and Hungarians did not usually like one another or mix, and considered each other a different people as their own. Its obvious the fool who wrote the article did not understand history or Europe during the dark or middle ages.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @CazadorSlayer
comment:
"They don't let you be a badass lady knight adventurer in a time period when women had the same rights as a sack of potatoes, when you would probably get hanged for even trying that. THE GAME DEVELOPER MUST BE SEXIST!"

"They don't have black folks everywhere, in every tiny little European village in the middle of bumfuck nowhere, in one of the whitest places in the friggin' World, during a time period where most people were extremely xenophobic and wouldn't let wanderers OF THEIR OWN NATIONALITY settle in their town, let alone straight-up foreigners...GAME DEVELOPER MUST BE RACIST!"

Good Lord, how stupid are people getting? The idiot practically proved his own point was false with his statement about how it was foolish to compare our modern ideals of race to the medieval ideals of ethnicity. Complaining how there were no 'non-white' people around when the very concept was relatively foreign to many of the people of that time period. Hell, I'm sure quite a few people back then didn't even know people could have darker colored skin, or different shaped eyes, or what have you. People didn't stray from where they were born very often unless they were soldiers or nobles performing 'diplomacy', or traders...well, trading in far-off lands. Life was very strongly community based. People didn't trust wanderers and travelers. Why would people drop all the familial ties they have in their home-town just to wander off and essentially sell off their rights as a trusted member of a community? People only did that when they had no damn choice in the matter. Hell, the same is true even today. Tell me one person living in one of those small towns where everyone knows each other, who WOULDN'T be at least passingly suspicious of any newcomers. Try. Oh, wait. You can't. People are naturally suspicious of strangers, especially when they look completely alien to them.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @samwell9261
comment:
So I just want to say that much of this video is poorly backed with facts and a good number of your facts that you do have are wrong, you don't at all back up your statement that there were no black people in medieval Europe (not to mention that you didn't specify Europe) which in fact is not true, part of Northern Africa was conquered by the Roman empire which is where Europe's contact with black people began. The African kingdoms took back there land during the fall of the Roman empires but did begin trade with Europeans due to the large amount of goods produced in Africa including cloth, textiles, shells, iron and copper. These trade items did include African slaves however that was not the majority of the trade items, the African merchants also traded with the Middle-Eastern countries as well as western Asia and India. So no, there were black people in Medieval Europe, but you are correct however in that they did not venture as far north as Bohemia. Another thing you got wrong is only talking about blacks, two nomadic kingdoms entered Bohemia in the early medieval time period, one being the Suebic people, who's origin I'm not entirely sure of but were an important part in the fall of Rome and the Sarmations another nomadic kingdoms from the modern day Eurasian steppe and their Ethnicity is categorized as Indo-Iranian steppe people. So yes there were non-white people in 15th century Bohemia just likely a minority, finally I want to touch upon the women aspect there were in fact NO FEMALE KNIGHTS or GENERALS there were female warriors and uprisings led by women but essentially no women in high places or in this case main roles. That last point was more clarification but I hope you retained some knowledge from the first couple of facts. I would like to say that I totally agree with your point, this "journalist" should be ashamed of himself, because, in fact the creators of Kingdom Come Deliverance are not racist or sexist the non-inclusion of other races is almost 100% historically accurate and their inclusion of women is reasonable for the times. I love your videos and am a fan of every game you show on this channel but if you make another video like this targeting idiotic posts and generally addressing blatantly wrong people please PLEASE find facts and back up your arguments.
-thanks

sources:
https://www.metmuseum.org/toah/hd/aftr/hd_aftr.htm
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bohemia
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarmatians
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women_in_post-classical_warfare

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @zerogbot23
comment: Medieval Bohemia wasn't exactly known for its black people. However there was a lot of diversity in the Holy Roman Empire, Germans, Czechs, Austrians, Hungarians, Tartar mercenaries/nomads. And of course there was the diversity between the nobility, lower class and the serfs. Most people didn't really travel it was probably pretty difficult to get from point A to point B, especially if you were traveling from Africa to Bohemia, bandits, wild animals, thiefs, treacherous weather, the shear distance you'd have to travel, all of that would be in your way. Just the thought of that puts me off so we can assume anyone back in the 1400s would probably feel the same. Now the reason you can't play as a woman is because of the realism the developers are trying to achieve, being a woman in the 1400s would have been  pretty awful, they had to cook, clean, and make babies, they weren't allowed to do very much outside of what medieval society dictated, so playing as a woman in a realistic medieval setting would be pretty boring, nobody would listen to you or respect your opinion because of your gender and that's a sad fact but to people in 1400s it made sense. You just can't apply modern social norms to a period piece because it doesn't work.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @minmaijd
comment: If you want to market a game nowadays it might help to stir up a little fake controversy very few people within your target demographic are going to take seriously in order to garner support and bring attention to your product.  Alternatively, if you want to broaden the scope of your demographics, you can kowtow to the new player base which will not only create controversy and attention, lose a few core player while gaining support from the majority (who perceive the issues as relatively minor or not detracting from the core experience) as well as welcoming a new swath of players.  Not only does surface level controversy bring fantastic attention to your title, it also heads off real criticisms of the game as it polarizes it player base. When you get people to start defending your product on any grounds, they've invested themselves and are more likely to continue to support your product where the might not have otherwise.  All in all, it's a relatively manageable risk and can be an effective marketing strategy.

comment: um, considering the premise of the story involves a mercenary Cuman army invading Bohemia under the orders of Sigismund, yes that would mean there would be a good number of "non-white" people involved, as Cumans were among the many steppe tribes migrating from Central Asia. Though the Cumans had picked up several smaller tribes on their journey west, the genetics of the time involved point to the M lineage (haplogroup D) shared with many East Asian peoples. Not to mention the Mongols had marched into Poland and Hungary just a few generations before this story's timeline, so there's that...

comment: That stuff is so cringeworthy. Standing up for equality is per se a good thing, but so is education. Trying to force a moorish character into the setting because moors existed in Spain, would be akin to chastising a game set in modern day Chicago because there were no Maori characters in it. It might not be literally impossible for moors to exist in Bohemia at that time, but it is safe to say that they would have been an incredibly rare oddity, so there probably weren't any. Maybe they are too much influenced by Hollywood trying to get a couple of non-white characters even into the historically whitest of settings, but they are doing their own cause a huge disservice by jumping on people for accurately portraying a setting that was historically dominated by white men instead of focusing on cases of actual whitewashing.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @meri5012
comment:
But are you SURE there were no black people in 15th century bohemia ? Did you read any article, asked any historian with knowledge on the question ? I disagree with the blogger who says it's racist not to include black characters in the game is racist, but considering there were no black people in Europe back then based solely on possibly not accurate knowledge could be reflecting some racism present in the society. Did the game devs make researches to know what composed their population back then ? How many merchants travelled across the country, where they came from and what could be their origins ? From what I know of History, merchants and traders could be from anywhere, from Asia to Africa, even in Europe. 

Remember, the concept of nation (i.e a people gotta have its own country) is very new. I think you won't find a trace of it before mid 19th century. So even though it maybe was tough being an other 'race' back then, there was no ideology to push people away because they were different (other than religion, we know how it went lol).  So is there any specialist (historian) expert on the matter who could answer to that question ? Lets get beyond our clich√©s and actually make research ? Anyone ?

tl;dr: Sure, if it is accurate historically and it is the aim of the game, fine. But the question is, is it actually accurate, and how do you know it is ? Wouldn't it be better for everyone to actually ask an expert on the matter than getting angry at a supposed 'racism' or 'SJW'-ism ?

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @jimmyincredible3141
comment:
These articles are a typical reflection of ignorant people who can't understand that other countries might be a bit different than their own / specifically the US.
Yes, the US had slavery / was involved in colonial slave trade, has a huge black population, and continues to have problems related to that. Also in Europe, GB, France, etc. had colonies everywhere, and thereby have relevant parts of their population "looking different" / originating from somewhere other than the pre-colonialism-france/GB.... But the Czech republic? It is a very predominantly white country ....so if there is a racism-problem, it affects a absolutely tiny percentage of the population there and has nowhere near the same gravity as in countries like the US.
So a) there is no problem that should be a theme due to current issues in society
b) if you aim for realism, I highly doubt a similar game set in todays (more mixed) czech republic would be justified in having more than maybe (!) one black czech in it...

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @vforvenom2299
comment:
Cumans are descended from the east, they are Asiatic and slightly Asian looking. They are leftovers from the Hun invasions in that part of the world. It's why the oldest depictions of them show Asiatic features similar to the Huns. 
But this video game makes it a point to conceal their faces behinds metal face plates and also mostly conceal other Cuman soldiers as well to not show their traits properly. 
I think the designer of this game would want users to assume that the Cumans are just like some Romanian looking people or something. 
The game includes a few characters that look like Europeans with small amounts of Asian mixture, but they should include more to be more realistic as many people in Hungary have some Asian mixture. title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @lamezorlord
comment:
To make it clear - around the 11:00 min mark, you talk about what the journal paper says. I think you misunderstood. The point is that racism wasnt considered the same in that black people werent thought as subhuman any more or less than any other nationality. The Eurocentric idea of superiority over other races was directly linked to the boom in slave trade and its growth as an industry as a justification to the public for why its ok to mass sell humans as animals. The thing is though, historically - this isnt relevant. Sure there were black people thoughout certain parts of Europe. The Moors left a huge cultural and genetic impact in Iberia. The Romans and their penchant for shuffling around subject peoples and armies (including auxilliaries from all over their empire) saw blacks from africa all the way in places like England millenia ago. The whole thing is though - this was no where near a common occurence and by no means spread throughout Europe. The presence of such ethnic diversity within medieval Europe can be directly linked to the empires and population shifts of the time period (predominantly the Romans and the Moors). The further you move away from those lands and locations the less likely black people would be barring unique cases. When you reach certain locations (ie Bohemia, Hungary, the Scandinavian lands or the lands of the Rus etc) you have less and less chance for random black people. It is irrelevant whether the societies were racist or not at the time - historically the presence of populations and ethnicities relied on the politics as well as migratory patters encouraged by wars, famines and trades.

To make a long story short - race was looked at differently back then. Still an irrelevant point considering the location in question would not have seen any more than unique cases of blacks.

comment:
Just look at that logic "because he believed it was "historically accurate" to not have any non-white characters anywhere, which is provably false given that medieval life was a melting pot of different races." Ok, all of you got that ?  The person who wrote that is saying that blablabla Medieval Ages = races all over the place and so on and so on. THE NEXT SENTENCE: "on how pointless it was to compare modern concepts of race to medieval notions of ethnicity" LMAO you've just contradicted yourself there !!!! One moment you're saying how stupid it is to associate modern concepts of race to medieval times and on the next sentence you're the one doing it !

The fun does not end there though.
 I quote: "a melting pot of different races" = the concept of the melting pot dates back to the 1780s and came into wide use in the early 1900s. Furthermore it is a modern conception of ETHNICITY which you associates here to "concepts of race." This is a big fat oxymoron according to the first page of the study you have referred to and which clearly distinguish between RACE and ETHNICITY in its INTRODUCTION. Get your logic together before trying to argue bullshit. You've probably haven't read the study (it is locked online and you have to get a subscription to get acces to it, I tried to see if my university had access to it but is doesn't unfortunately) you have quoted or worse : you did not understood a single bit of it, using it in a dishonest way as an argument of authority.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @CZpersi
comment: It is like asking different races to appear in a game about medieval Japan, or the Chineese to appear in an ancient Egypt. Medieval Bohemia had little contacts with areas like Africa or Asia.  There were some traders, who passed through the region (for example, the first testimony on Prague was written in Arabic by a Jewish merchant), but no stable "non-white" population. The possibility of meeting "non-whites" in the rural areas of medieval Bohemia was next to zero. You could meet some lone Arab or Turkish merchant. There were Jewish ghettoes and villages. If a black person was to appear in the story, however, it would have to be somehow explained - how he got there in the first place.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @knightofarnor2552
comment: There actually is documentary evidence that at least a few blacks got to the Holy Roman Empire by the 1460s, although that's too late for the game. It's because in the 1420s was the first European contact with sub-Saharan peoples, by the Portuguese. The evidence in question is illustrations from a fightbook by Sir Hans Talhoffer from the Kingdom of Swabia. The fact this lone black is learning from a renowned fightmaster of the day tells us he wasn't a slave- in fact, he may have had a fair amount of money. However, an exception does not a rule make. And like I said, there wouldn't have been any blacks at all that far north until after the Portuguese circumnavigation of Africa some 20 years after the game is set.
