title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Tyrhor
comment:
A few details: V√°vra was rather on the openly on the racists side in 2015 during the so called Refugee crisis. I have had a few discussions with him mostly on the internet (even though his office is just across the street from mine...) However, that was about the predominant motivation of people from Sahel, leaving to Europe.
However: There were no blacks in Bohemia in 1400. The only contact with people from Africa for someone in Holy Roman Empire (of which the capital was in Bohemia at that point) was through contact with Morokans in Granada and Sudani people in Holy lands. Yes, those were known to scholars and knights returning from those places (and you can actually find pictures of them (mostly Saint Mauricius, (meaning literally Saint Blackguy), who was a knight switching sides, joining Crusaders and The black queen of Saba, (again, literally called "The black queen"...)
However, meeting someone of color in the middle of Europe (look on the map for christ sake) was nearly impossible.
The only way I can imagine would be meeting a spices or fabric merchant from Ottoman empire, but it would be rather unlikely, knowing the location of the castle on which the game takes a place (why would he go to such place. It is a day or two away from the main roads, I really can't find any reason to do so)
Lastly: A female hero: If the game was still historically accurate, being a female would suck from the game perspective. You see, females are way more valuable for the whole society than males. Therefore, they are usually somewhere safe...

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @sundiataq
comment:
I'm also black and cringed out at the sjw obsession to include non-whites in historically white stories. Of course I'd like to see more Africans in historical computer-games, but only in a relevant context of course, like Africa for example, not 15th century Bohemia ffs... Jeez...¬†

For example, now there's a new series on Troy with a black Achilles... Why??? Memnon, King of the Ethiopians, was actually an important character in Homer's Iliad. There's literally no need for a fictional black Greek Hero, when we have a historical black one, in the SAME story...¬†

Some of this stuff is just intended to piss off alt-righters, and drive an even greater wedge between different communities...¬†

From black people all over the world: We really don't want black characters in unhistorical settings... We want black characters in historical ones. There's a lot of crazy interesting stuff going on all over the African continent in the 15th century... Plenty of stuff to work with: Mali Empire, Abyssinian Empire, Hausa Kingdoms, Swahili City States, Kanem Bornu... If you want blacks in Europe, the Berbers of Al Andalus employed armies of blacks from "the Sudan"... But Bohemia? Really?

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @darken2417
comment:
There was something historically inaccurate in this video. Medieval Europe did not by default believe that some people were inferior or superior due to their skin color and no this was not accepted or widespread by any means. First off Europe was incredibly religious and of a religion that proposes that every human can get to heaven. Secondly there were/are historic black saints from the time of Rome that were studied and revered by medieval peoples. Not to mention that they knew of there being black Christians in such places in Africa like Ethiopia that were being purged by Islamic expansion. 

The reason you can't compare modern concept of race to the medieval view on ethnicity is because race was not a concept. Every black person was not seen as being of a single race as we do today. They understood that someone from Northern Africa had distinct differences than someone from East Africa that made them not be a single overarching group like a race. Something that we modern people have forgotten. Ethnicity in medieval Europe was not as volatile as today. Two separate kingdoms with different languages and cultures were able to peacefully unite into a single entity through marriage, without any sort of tension. In the Crusades they didn't impose a racial caste system on the people of the Levant. As long as someone converted they were just seen as a new part of their civilization.

If anything the modern world is more racist. In the modern world nationality comes first, then culture, then race, then ideology, and far last is religion. In the medieval world religion came first regardless of background, then ideology, then culture, and last is race or ethnicity. (They had no concept of nationality which is why states could merge so easily) Yes people were uncomfortable around foreigners and those that were different but that isn't racism that is how people are. Strangers breed a sense of insecurity and suspicion.
Show less
REPLY

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Zhongda95
comment: It is rather troubling that everyone here jumps to conclusions based on such a lack of actual information. A simple twitter or google search is not enough to investigate the basis of the article's accusations. I don't know a lot about Vavra's political beliefs (although they seem to be  those of a classic right wing guy coming from a pre-communist country) but the fact that he openly supported gamergate is at least troubling. Now, no one should jump to conclusions about how the directors' political opinions will affect the game since this might not be a negative thing, or it might as well be. The thing is, we should stop trying to "protect" games from the reality of politics, especially if we are talking about a "historically accurate" game, and protect it based on our contemporary false notions of the status of racism in medieval Europe. Wether the game is going to be "politically correct" or not is not based on the inclusion of black people or the playability of female characters, but on the actual way the political issues of that time period are going to be handled. Vavra has promised that he is going for a "mature story", which clearly cannot stay clear from the inclusion of politics in it.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Torag55
comment: Just gonna say this: isn't Bohemia populated by both Czechs and Germans at that time? They're both white peoples, yes, but they're different cultures altogether and belong to different branching language groups. Even the Cumans are in there, and they're a Turkic people that originally came from the Central Asian steppes. That should be enough diversity to satisfy those who want it but nooooo. I find SJW complaints to be utterly ridiculous. This was what happened in history. BTW, I'm Filipino and I'm not offended by Vavra being truthful. Why? Because it makes sense. Bohemia is so far inland. It's nowhere near Spain, where I think the Moors are getting their asses handed to them by the Spanish and their Reconquista. It's nowhere near coastal areas. It is also surrounded by other diverse groups of whites, like I mentioned above being the Czechs and Germans (not sure if there are other groups of Slavs or other peoples of whitish color there). If my people, the Filipinos, are there for some reason in the game, it would not make sense and looks inaccurate and not pertaining to history. So really, I wish people would stop twisting history and applying 21st century viewpoints in a game obviously set in the Middle Ages, where the mindset is obviously far far different from the 21st mindset.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @Twentenaer
comment:
Women staying home to take care of their children is in no way sexist, it is the natural and biological role they have been given. And it is crucial for a society to stay alive. If feminists would have been controlling things back in those days, Europe would not even exist anymore. I just wanted to get that off my chest.
Furthermore, 15th century Europeans weren't as racist as people like you to believe, with perhaps the exception of anti-semitism. Most importantly there was not yet any theory about race. There were just christians and non-christians (jews, muslims, heathens), so calling medieval Europeans racist is utterly wrong. Besides, most people just lived amongst their own, not travelling far, without having any contact to blacks or other coloured peoples, making it physically impossible to be racist against blacks.

Damn, I hate these SJW's. They should leave our history alone. Better yet, they should be completely erased from history.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @karelcharvat1169
comment: In many parts of the Czech Republic, especially in the rural areas, it is VERY rare to meet black people even today. Of course, in larger cities where there are offices of major international companies or in the most famous tourist areas, you will meet people of different races and nationalities. But even today, the percentage of non-white people in the Czech Republic is very small. The most numerous group of non-white people are Gypsies and Vietnamese. If you spent a week in the real world places where the game takes place, you would probably have over 90% chance of not seeing anyone black even today. And now, racial diversity in the Czech Republic is noticeably larger than, for example, 20 years ago and incomparably larger than in the Middle Ages.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @aidansumner8364
comment:
You're wrong about some things. Back then there was no racism until the Portuguese started the slave trade. People back then judged you more on your religion and land that you came from over your race. They couldn't care less about race back then. In fact on the occasion a black would ever come to Europe (although I suspect they were really Berbers and historians are just being SJW's) they were welcomed heartily... if they converted to Christendom of course.
Also I would say the medieval period is not as sexist as people think. It would have been seen as immoral so send a woman to war and the women back then agreed and had no problems with it. Men were actually FORCED to go to war whilst the women concentrated on their home lives, home lives being one of the most important things for your survival unlike how we modern people are perceiving it, due to it not being as important anymore.
Women seemed too have an privilege of not being forced into war if anything. Is being forced into war a pleasantry?
Men who didn't respect women would be seen as immoral and women who didn't respect men would have been seen immoral.

I like the video though, I am sick of how everything has to be blackwashed and feminised out of realism just to get by in our industry anymore. My comment above if anything just supports your video.

title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance Racist?
author: @jackmclean3210
comment: ...I think you're straw-manning a bit. I don't think it's at all fair to say that it's obviously nonsense after only scrolling through a few days worth of tweets. He's making reference to the pro-gamergate comments made in the past. It's not at all unreasonable to levy criticism against him for this, especially as the path from gamergate through to the contemporary alt-right is fairly clear. Also, what strikes me is that all of this 'insistence on historical accuracy' always seems to be a little more impassioned than would seem rational for that cause, why would it be unacceptable to compromise accuracy for the sake of representation? People always get very upset about black soldiers in WW1, complaining about historical accuracy, but ignore the fact that everyone is running around with automatic weapons, and also that all major powers used thousands of colonial troops. 'Historical accuracy' is very often used as an excuse to be racist by people who often know fuck all about history(see Paul Joseph Watson vs Mary Beard on twitter). I really don't think that you or Daniel are racists, maybe a little bit overconfident in some shaky pre-conceptions about the middle ages and also a misunderstanding of what SJW types are trying to say. However, actual proper white supremacists do seem to love the middle ages as some kind of white utopia, which is a load of bollocks, as well as a bit of a warning sign. See this website for a more nuanced discussion of race in medieval times https://www.publicmedievalist.com/race-racism-middle-ages-tearing-whites-medieval-world/
